title: Ticket #3864: Improve UPDATE_JOBAD handling in the schedd
description:
We've recently discovered some bugs and inefficiencies in how the schedd handles sending UPDATE_JOBAD signals to the shadow/gridmanager when a user qedits a job. The bugs have been fixed in 8.0. Other issues should be addressed in 8.1.

  • DAGMan shouldn't use SETDIRTY flag (#3863)
  • Schedd shouldn't try to notify scheduler universe jobs (#3785)
  • In SetAttribute(), don't try to send an UPDATE_JOBAD if the job is already in DirtyJobIDs (#3909)
  • The gridmanager should only be signaled once for all jobs it's managing, not once for each job. (#3909)
  • If there's no shadow or gridmanager for a job, the dirty bits should cleared and the job should be removed from DirtyJobIDs. (#3909)
  • Local and standard universe jobs aren't handled properly.
    • For now, prevent the schedd from trying to send signals for these jobs (#3909)
  • Do we need a periodic timer to constantly send UPDATE_JOBAD signals to the shadows/gridmanagers?
    • Yes, because shadow only tries to retrieve dirty attributes once.
  • Should DirtyJobIDs be a hashtable with PROC_ID keys?
  • Dirty attribute tracking and shadow/gridmanager notification isn't transaction-aware.
